item.title: Leveraging Satellite Data to Understand the Economic Implications of Sri Lanka’s Fertilizer Import Ban in 2021
item.description: In May 2021, Sri Lanka’s government imposed a sudden ban on imports of chemical fertilizers. The World Bank’s Trade and International Integration Unit of the Development Research Group utilized satellite data, including Planet, to quantify the changes in tea yield since the ban, as part of a study aimed at understanding how the ban affected the country’s agricultural production and trade.

item.title: Leveraging New Data Methods to Address an Ancient Challenge: Locusts
item.description: Challenge: The worst locust upsurge in at least 25 years is hitting parts of Africa, the Arabian Peninsula and Western Asia, and over 40 million people who are already food insecure find their food supply and livelihoods threatened.
